abstract: Amazon reports that operating income for the third quarter fell 71 percent from 2010, following earlier warnings, largely ignored by investors, that performance would be weak; company's stock sank $25 in after-hours trading, reducing its market cap in one day by about $16 billion.
snippet: The online retailer had a 44 percent increase in revenue, but investors still fled the stock in after-hours trading.
lead_paragraph: The online retailer had a 44 percent increase in revenue, but investors still fled the stock in after-hours trading.

headline.main: Amazon Suffers Big Drop in Income
headline.print_headline: Amazon Suffers Big Drop In Income
headline.seo: Amazon Reports a Sharp Decline in Income
